intro: Pandiaka carsonii, commonly known as Carson's pandiaka, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
